N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 542.2 - Legal base

State Regulations
(a) Section
7.09
of the

Mental Hygiene Law grants the Commissioner of Mental Health the power and
responsibility to adopt regulations that are necessary and proper to implement
matters under his or her jurisdiction. (b) Section
7.11
(a) of the Mental Hygiene Law gives the
commissioner the professional jurisdiction, supervision and control of the
office and all department facilities for the mentally ill. (c) Section
31.03
(h) of the Mental Hygiene Law authorizes the
commissioner to promulgate regulations to more effectively assure that the
life, health, safety and comfort of persons cared for in family care homes will
be adequately protected and promoted, and that such persons will receive the
kind and quality of care, supervision and attention required by reason of their
condition. (d) Section
31.04
of
the Mental Hygiene Law authorizes the commissioner to adopt regulations which
set standards of qualify and adequacy of facilities, equipment, personnel, services, records and the condition of services for the mentally disabled
rendered pursuant to an operating certificate. (e) Section
31.07
of
the Mental Hygiene Law authorizes the commissioner to conduct investigations
into the operations of providers of service which are required by article 31 to
have operating certificates and to make inspections of facilities to determine
whether providers are complying with applicable laws, rules and
regulations. Notes
